when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings.
example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！ (arigatou, tetsudatte kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used when greeting someone in the afternoon.
example: こんにちは、元気ですか？ (konnichiwa, genki desu ka?) - Hello, how are you?

when_to_say: Used when parting with someone for a long time.
example: さようなら、また会いましょう (sayounara, mata aimashou) - Goodbye, see you again!

when_to_say: Used when requesting something politely.
example: 水をください、お願いします (mizu wo kudasai, onegaishimasu) - Water, please.

when_to_say: Used to apologize or get someone's attention.
example: すみません、道を教えてください (sumimasen, michi wo oshiete kudasai) - Excuse me, please tell me the way.

when_to_say: Used to affirm or agree with someone.
example: はい、わかりました (hai, wakarimashita) - Yes, I understand.

when_to_say: Used to disagree or decline politely.
example: いいえ、違います (iie, chigaimasu) - No, that's not correct.

when_to_say: Used to ask or describe someone's health or energy.
example: 元気ですか？ (genki desu ka?) - Are you well?

when_to_say: Used to reassure someone or confirm that something is okay.
example: 大丈夫です、心配しないで (daijoubu desu, shinpai shinaide) - It's okay, don't worry.

when_to_say: Used to describe tasty food.
example: このケーキは美味しいです (kono keeki wa oishii desu) - This cake is delicious.

when_to_say: Used to describe being occupied with work or tasks.
example: 今日は忙しいです (kyou wa isogashii desu) - I am busy today.

when_to_say: Used to describe enjoyable activities or experiences.
example: パーティーは楽しかったです (paatii wa tanoshikatta desu) - The party was fun.

when_to_say: Used to describe fear or something frightening.
example: この映画は怖いです (kono eiga wa kowai desu) - This movie is scary.

when_to_say: Used to describe cold weather or temperature.
example: 今日は寒いです (kyou wa samui desu) - It's cold today.

when_to_say: Used to describe hot weather or temperature.
example: 今日は暑いです (kyou wa atsui desu) - It's hot today.

when_to_say: Used to describe beauty or cleanliness.
example: この花は綺麗です (kono hana wa kirei desu) - This flower is beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to describe something fun, entertaining, or interesting.
example: この本は面白いです (kono hon wa omoshiroi desu) - This book is interesting.

when_to_say: Used when you understand something.
example: 日本語が分かります (nihongo ga wakarimasu) - I understand Japanese.

when_to_say: Used when talking about going somewhere.
example: 学校に行きます (gakkou ni ikimasu) - I go to school.

when_to_say: Used when talking about coming to a place.
example: 友達が来ます (tomodachi ga kimasu) - My friend is coming.

when_to_say: Used when talking about eating food.
example: 寿司を食べます (sushi wo tabemasu) - I eat sushi.

when_to_say: Used when talking about drinking liquids.
example: 水を飲みます (mizu wo nomimasu) - I drink water.

when_to_say: Used when talking about going to bed or sleeping.
example: 早く寝ます (hayaku nemasu) - I go to bed early.

when_to_say: Used when talking about waking up in the morning.
example: 毎朝7時に起きます (maiasa shichi-ji ni okimasu) - I wake up at 7 every morning.

when_to_say: Used when talking about purchasing something.
example: 本を買います (hon wo kaimasu) - I buy a book.

when_to_say: Used when talking about selling something.
example: 野菜を売ります (yasai wo urimasu) - I sell vegetables.

when_to_say: Used when talking about reading books or documents.
example: 新聞を読みます (shinbun wo yomimasu) - I read the newspaper.

when_to_say: Used when talking about writing something.
example: 手紙を書きます (tegami wo kakimasu) - I write a letter.

when_to_say: Used when talking about speaking or communicating.
example: 日本語を話します (nihongo wo hanashimasu) - I speak Japanese.

when_to_say: Used when listening or asking questions.
example: 音楽を聞きます (ongaku wo kikimasu) - I listen to music.

when_to_say: Used when watching something or observing.
example: 映画を見ます (eiga wo mimasu) - I watch a movie.

when_to_say: Used when making or creating something.
example: ケーキを作ります (keeki wo tsukurimasu) - I make a cake.

when_to_say: Used when using an object or tool.
example: このアプリを使います (kono apuri wo tsukaimasu) - I use this app.

when_to_say: Used when talking about walking somewhere.
example: 公園を歩きます (kouen wo arukimasu) - I walk in the park.

when_to_say: Used when talking about running or moving fast on foot.
example: 毎朝走ります (maiasa hashirimasu) - I run every morning.

when_to_say: Used when engaging in recreational activities.
example: 友達と遊びます (tomodachi to asobimasu) - I play with my friends.

when_to_say: Used when talking about swimming.
example: プールで泳ぎます (puuru de oyogimasu) - I swim in the pool.

when_to_say: Used when standing up from sitting or lying down.
example: ここに立ってください (koko ni tatte kudasai) - Please stand here.

when_to_say: Used when sitting down.
example: 椅子に座ります (isu ni suwarimasu) - I sit on the chair.

when_to_say: Used when talking about knowing information or facts.
example: そのことを知っています (sono koto wo shitteimasu) - I know that.

when_to_say: Used when forgetting something.
example: 鍵を忘れました (kagi wo wasuremashita) - I forgot my keys.

when_to_say: Used when remembering or memorizing something.
example: 漢字を覚えます (kanji wo oboemasu) - I memorize kanji.

when_to_say: Used when waiting for someone or something.
example: 駅で友達を待ちます (eki de tomodachi wo machimasu) - I wait for my friend at the station.

when_to_say: Used when calling someone's name or inviting someone.
example: 先生を呼びます (sensei wo yobimasu) - I call the teacher.

when_to_say: Used when talking about working at a job or task.
example: 会社で働きます (kaisha de hatarakimasu) - I work at the company.

when_to_say: Used when taking a break or resting.
example: 午後は少し休みます (gogo wa sukoshi yasumimasu) - I rest a little in the afternoon.

when_to_say: Used when talking about visiting an amusement park.
example: 週末に遊園地に行きます (shuumatsu ni yuuenchi ni ikimasu) - I go to the amusement park on weekends.

when_to_say: Used when talking about hospitals or medical care.
example: 病院へ行きます (byouin e ikimasu) - I go to the hospital.

when_to_say: Used when talking about train or bus stations.
example: 駅で待ちます (eki de machimasu) - I wait at the station.

when_to_say: Used when talking about school or educational institutions.
example: 学校に行きます (gakkou ni ikimasu) - I go to school.

when_to_say: Used when talking about books or reading material.
example: 本を読みます (hon wo yomimasu) - I read a book.

when_to_say: Used when talking about newspapers.
example: 新聞を読みます (shinbun wo yomimasu) - I read the newspaper.

when_to_say: Used when talking about watching movies.
example: 映画を見ます (eiga wo mimasu) - I watch a movie.

when_to_say: Used when talking about listening to music.
example: 音楽を聞きます (ongaku wo kikimasu) - I listen to music.

when_to_say: Used when talking about cars or driving.
example: 車を運転します (kuruma wo untenshimasu) - I drive a car.

when_to_say: Used when talking about bicycles or cycling.
example: 自転車で学校に行きます (jitensha de gakkou ni ikimasu) - I go to school by bicycle.

when_to_say: Used when talking about airports or flights.
example: 空港に行きます (kuukou ni ikimasu) - I go to the airport.

when_to_say: Used when talking about airplanes or flights.
example: 飛行機に乗ります (hikouki ni norimasu) - I board the airplane.

when_to_say: Used when talking about cars.
example: 自動車を運転します (jidousha wo untenshimasu) - I drive a car.

when_to_say: Used when talking about roads or directions.
example: 道を歩きます (michi wo arukimasu) - I walk on the road.

when_to_say: Used when talking about friends.
example: 友達と遊びます (tomodachi to asobimasu) - I play with my friend.

when_to_say: Used when talking about family members.
example: 家族と旅行します (kazoku to ryokou shimasu) - I travel with my family.

when_to_say: Used when talking about your mother.
example: 母は優しいです (haha wa yasashii desu) - My mother is kind.

when_to_say: Used when talking about your father.
example: 父は働いています (chichi wa hataraiteimasu) - My father is working.

when_to_say: Used when talking about your older sister.
example: 姉は学生です (ane wa gakusei desu) - My older sister is a student.

when_to_say: Used when talking about your younger sister.
example: 妹はかわいいです (imouto wa kawaii desu) - My younger sister is cute.

when_to_say: Used when talking about your older brother.
example: 兄はサッカーが上手です (ani wa sakkaa ga jouzu desu) - My older brother is good at soccer.

when_to_say: Used when talking about your younger brother.
example: 弟は元気です (otouto wa genki desu) - My younger brother is healthy.

when_to_say: Used to describe the color red.
example: 赤い花です (akai hana desu) - It is a red flower.

when_to_say: Used to describe the color blue.
example: 青い空です (aoi sora desu) - It is a blue sky.

when_to_say: Used to describe the color yellow.
example: 黄色い帽子です (kiiroi boushi desu) - It is a yellow hat.

when_to_say: Used to describe the color green.
example: 緑の葉です (midori no ha desu) - It is a green leaf.

when_to_say: Used to describe the color black.
example: 黒い猫です (kuroi neko desu) - It is a black cat.

when_to_say: Used to describe the color white.
example: 白い犬です (shiroi inu desu) - It is a white dog.

when_to_say: Used to describe something new.
example: 新しい靴です (atarashii kutsu desu) - These are new shoes.

when_to_say: Used to describe something old.
example: 古い本です (furui hon desu) - It is an old book.

when_to_say: Used to describe height or price.
example: このビルは高いです (kono biru wa takai desu) - This building is tall.

when_to_say: Used to describe price or cost.
example: この本は安いです (kono hon wa yasui desu) - This book is cheap.

when_to_say: Used to describe size.
example: 大きい家です (ookii ie desu) - It is a big house.

when_to_say: Used to describe size.
example: 小さい猫です (chiisai neko desu) - It is a small cat.

when_to_say: Used to describe speed.
example: 車は速いです (kuruma wa hayai desu) - The car is fast.

when_to_say: Used to describe slowness or being late.
example: 電車は遅いです (densha wa osoi desu) - The train is slow.

when_to_say: Used to describe length or duration.
example: 川は長いです (kawa wa nagai desu) - The river is long.

when_to_say: Used to describe length or duration.
example: 髪が短いです (kami ga mijikai desu) - My hair is short.

when_to_say: Used to describe voice pitch.
example: 彼女は高い声です (kanojo wa takai koe desu) - She has a high-pitched voice.

when_to_say: Used to describe voice pitch.
example: 彼は低い声です (kare wa hikui koe desu) - He has a low-pitched voice.

when_to_say: Used for people who get hot easily.
example: 私は暑がりです (watashi wa atsugari desu) - I get hot easily.

when_to_say: Used for people who feel cold easily.
example: 弟は寒がりです (otouto wa samugari desu) - My brother feels cold easily.

when_to_say: Used to express inconvenience or annoyance.
example: 宿題は面倒くさいです (shukudai wa mendoukusai desu) - Homework is annoying.

when_to_say: Used to express happiness.
example: 合格して嬉しいです (goukaku shite ureshii desu) - I am glad to have passed.

when_to_say: Used to express sadness.
example: 試合に負けて悲しいです (shiai ni makete kanashii desu) - I am sad because we lost the game.

when_to_say: Used to express fatigue or tiredness.
example: 仕事で疲れた (shigoto de tsukareta) - I am tired from work.

when_to_say: Used to describe comfort or ease.
example: この椅子は楽です (kono isu wa raku desu) - This chair is comfortable.

when_to_say: Used when talking about being occupied or busy.
example: 今週は忙しいです (konshuu wa isogashii desu) - I am busy this week.

when_to_say: Used to describe quietness or calmness.
example: 図書館は静かです (toshokan wa shizuka desu) - The library is quiet.

when_to_say: Used to describe a lively place or atmosphere.
example: 祭りは賑やかです (matsuri wa nigiyaka desu) - The festival is lively.

when_to_say: Used to describe difficulty or complexity.
example: 数学は難しいです (suugaku wa muzukashii desu) - Math is difficult.

when_to_say: Used to describe something easy or simple.
example: この問題は簡単です (kono mondai wa kantan desu) - This problem is easy.

when_to_say: Used to describe time or speed.
example: 電車は早いです (densha wa hayai desu) - The train is fast.

when_to_say: Used to describe time or speed.
example: 私は遅いです (watashi wa osoi desu) - I am late.
